text: hi my name is Rebecca and in today's
lesson we're going to talk about
personal pronouns now these are often
confused by many students who are
learning English so let's look at what
they are and why they cause confusion
and how to clarify in your mind which
one to use in which situation
okay so we have pronouns here that are
used as the subject and we have another
line of pronouns here which are used as
the object in a sentence so let's look
at an example we could say for example I
like John right
but John likes me in the first sentence
eyes being used as the subject in the
second sentence me is being used as the
object you like John John likes you he
likes John John likes him she likes John
John likes her we like John John likes
us they like John John likes then okay
you see how in the first sentence in
each case we were using the subject
pronoun right and in the second sentence
we were using the object from
let's look at some more examples so if
you're using it as a subject you would
say I like ice cream not me like ice
cream but I like ice cream sometimes
children when they're really young they
did confuse that they say things like me
like ice cream but it's not correct
incorrect Englishmen would say I like
ice cream he plays tennis not him plays
tennis but he plays tennis because we're
using it as a subject of the sentence
she and I are going out she and I are
going out we don't say her and me are
going out because you need to use these
pronouns as the subject of the sentence
now another small point is that when we
talk about some other people as well as
I right then we usually mention the
other people first having mentioned I
lust okay she and I we don't usually say

used as the object in a sentence then we

don't call them right not dark all day
but don't call them
please tell her please tell her to call
him it's been used as the object of the
sentence also we use these object
pronouns after prepositions for example
I went with then with is the preposition
we don't say good day but with them she
sent it to me not she sent it to I but

and also we use them these second form
